name: Display monthly data
info:
The daily values are averaged and displayed for the selected month. It is easy to see how it changes from year to year because it overlaps each year.

x-axis : average for a day during selected month
y-axis : sensor data for every year

name: Display annual data
info:
Averages the values for one month and displays the values for the entered year.

x-axis : average for a month
y-axis : sensor data

name: extract sensor data
SQL query
func:
msg.topic = "select t.month, avg(Battery_voltage) as Battery_voltage, avg(VIN_voltage) as VIN_voltage \
, avg(Ambient_temperature) as Ambient_temperature, avg(Ambient_humidity) as Ambient_humidity \
, avg(Barometric_pressure) as Barometric_pressure, avg(Gas_resistance) as Gas_resistance \
, avg(Soil_temperature) as Soil_temperature, avg(Soil_moisture) as Soil_moisture \
, avg(UV_intensity) as UV_intensity \
from ( \
select month(time) as 'month', sum(Battery_voltage) as Battery_voltage, sum(VIN_voltage) as VIN_voltage \
, sum(Ambient_temperature) as Ambient_temperature, sum(Ambient_humidity) as Ambient_humidity \
, sum(Barometric_pressure) as Barometric_pressure, sum(Gas_resistance) as Gas_resistance \
, sum(Soil_temperature) as Soil_temperature, sum(Soil_moisture) as Soil_moisture \
, sum(UV_intensity) as UV_intensity \
from `iot-weather`.SensorData \
where year(time)="+msg.payload+" \
group by time \
) t \
group by t.month";

return msg;

name: Ambient Humidity
func:
msg.payload = msg.Ambient_humidity;
return msg;

msg.payload = msg.Barometric_pressure;

name: Gas Resistance
func:
msg.payload = msg.Gas_resistance;

name: SQL query
func:
msg.topic = "select date_format(time, '%Y-%m-%d') as day, \
avg(Battery_voltage) as Battery_voltage, avg(VIN_voltage) as VIN_voltage \
, avg(Ambient_temperature) as Ambient_temperature, avg(Ambient_humidity) as Ambient_humidity \
, avg(Barometric_pressure) as Barometric_pressure, avg(Gas_resistance) as Gas_resistance \
, avg(Soil_temperature) as Soil_temperature, avg(Soil_moisture) as Soil_moisture \
, avg(UV_intensity) as UV_intensity \
from `iot-weather`.SensorData \
where "+"\""+msg.payload+"\"" +" between \
		DATE_FORMAT( \
		  DATE_ADD(time, INTERVAL (WEEKDAY(time)) * -1 DAY), \
		  '%Y-%m-%d' \
		) \
		and \
		DATE_FORMAT( \
		  DATE_ADD(time, INTERVAL (6 - WEEKDAY(time)) * +1 DAY), \
		  '%Y-%m-%d' \
		) \
group by day \
order by day asc";
return msg;

name: Soil Temperature
func:
msg.payload = msg.Soil_temperature;
return msg;

name: Soil Moisture

msg.payload = msg.Soil_moisture;
return msg;

name: UV Intensity
func:
msg.payload = msg.UV_intensity;
return msg;

name: SQL insert query
SQL query
func:
msg.topic = "select Year(t.day) as year, t.day, Battery_voltage, VIN_voltage \
, Ambient_temperature, Ambient_humidity \
, Barometric_pressure, Gas_resistance \
, Soil_temperature, Soil_moisture \
, UV_intensity \
	from ( \
	select date_format(time, '%Y-%m-%d') as day, avg(Battery_voltage) as Battery_voltage, avg(VIN_voltage) as VIN_voltage \
	, avg(Ambient_temperature) as Ambient_temperature, avg(Ambient_humidity) as Ambient_humidity \
	, avg(Barometric_pressure) as Barometric_pressure, avg(Gas_resistance) as Gas_resistance \
	, avg(Soil_temperature) as Soil_temperature, avg(Soil_moisture) as Soil_moisture \
	, avg(UV_intensity) as UV_intensity \
		from `iot-weather`.SensorData \
	where Month(time)="+msg.payload+" \
	group by day \
	order by day asc \
	) t";
return msg;

name: select column

Among the columns in the database, select the column required for display.

Depending on the year, it should be expressed with different graphs so that several graphs overlap.
First, after obtaining all the years, only the corresponding year is expressed as an array. 
And this array was pushed to the _sensor_ array, which is the final array to be returned. 
Finally, the _sensor_ array is entered in the data value of msg.payload. 
Since the _sensor_ array is a 2-dimensional array, the graph can be displayed differently for each year.

name: query
info:
When input is received through the_ week input_, a date for the week becomes the output value.
It is first checked in the where clause whether this date is within the desired week, and then the average value of the day is calculated and displayed.

func:

return msg;

name: E-mail alert
info: If the value measured by the sensor is higher/lower than a certain value, an alarm is sent to the user's e-mail.

name: alert condition
info: Use the switch node to set the condition to send an email alarm.

name: send email every 30 minitues
info:
Using a trigger node, an email is sent every 30 minutes.

It seems that the previous message and the currently received message are output at the same time, so the output of the previous message and the current output are divided, and only the current message is output.

name: join node
info: In order to compare the condition value input by the user and the sensor value received through communication at once, it was put in one msg through the join node and compared.

name: Celsius to Fahrenheit

return msg;
